tool.name: SAGA.ta_slope_stability.4
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDEM False isArrayC False isArrayD False isArrayEmin False isArrayEmax False output_data_F $output_data_F name SAGA.ta_slope_stability.4 DEM $DEM C $C D $D Emin $Emin Emax $Emax fC $fC fD $fD fEmin $fEmin fEmax $fEmax ff $ff fI $fI METHOD $METHOD prefer $prefer response $response outputType_F $OutputSection_F.outputType_F transmissionMode_F $OutputSection_F.transmissionMode_F

param.name: DEM
param.label: DEM
param.help: A DEM The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: C
param.label: Dip/Plunge direction grid (degree)
param.help: A dip- or plunge direction grid (in degrees) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: D
param.label: Dip/Plunge grid (degree)
param.help: A dip- or plunge grid (in degrees) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: Emin
param.label: Min friction angle grid (degree)
param.help: A minimum discontinuity friction angle grid (in degrees) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: Emax
param.label: Max friction angle grid (degree)
param.help: A maximum discontinuity friction angle grid (in degrees) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: fC
param.label: Global dip/plunge direction (degree)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fD
param.label: Global dip/plunge (degree)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fEmin
param.label: Min global friction angle (degree)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fEmax
param.label: Max global friction angle (degree)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: ff
param.label: Cone radius (degree)
param.help: Radius of optional cone variance (in degrees)

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_F
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_F
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: <br/>This tool determines terrain elements where failure (slide- or topple movements) on geological discontinuies are kinematically possible through the spatial application of common frictional feasibility criteria (Günther et al. 2012 and references therein). Both the orientation of slope elements specified through aspect- and dip grids (in radians) are required together with the orientation of one planar structure defined through global- or grid dip direction and dip data, or two planar structures defined by plunge direction and plunge information of their intersection line (in degrees). The shear strength of the discontinuities is specified using global or grid-based friction angle data. Optionally, a cone value can be set allowing for some variance in discontinuity dip orientations. The tool operates in slide (testing for plane and wedge sliding) or topple (testing for plane and wedge toppling) modes.<br/><br/>Reference:<br/><a href="http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11069-011-9771-2.">Günther A., Wienhöfer J., Konietzky H. (2012) Automated mapping of rock slope geometry, kinematics and stability with RSS-GIS. Natural Hazards, 61, 29-49.</a>.<br/>
